intro: Drymonia betancurii, commonly known as the Betancurii fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a whorled pattern around the stems. Drymonia betancurii is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in the cooler, mountainous regions of its native habitat.
